post.description:
The orderForm simulation endpoint is used to simulate a cart in VTEX Checkout.

It receives an **SKU ID**, the **quantity** of items in the cart, the ID of the **Seller** and the **country** in ISO ALPHA-3 Code (eg. BRA, USA, ARG).

It sends back all information about the cart, such as the selling price of each item, rates and benefits data, payment and logistics info.

This is useful whenever you need to know the avaiability of fulfilling an order for a specific cart setting, since the API response will let you know the updated price, inventory and shipping data.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description:
This call removes all items from a given cart, leaving it empty.

The ID of the specific cart whose items you want to remove is passed as an URL paramater, replacing the variable `orderFormId` in this example. 

The `orderFormId` is the identification number of a given cart. That is, it's the ID of a specific orderForm.

You must send an empy JSON in the body of the request.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items you want to remove.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
This call removes all user information, leaving the orderForm anonymous. That is, it keeps the items of the cart in the orderForm.

This call works by creating a new orderForm, setting a new cookie and returning a redirect 302 to the cart URL (`/checkout/#/orderform`).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose user's personal data you want to remove.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items you want to update.

parameters.name: allowOutdatedData
parameters.description:
In order to optimize performance, this parameter allows some information to not be updated when there are changes in the minicart. For instance, if a shopper adds another unit of a given SKU to the cart, it may not be necessary to recalculate payment information, which could impact performance.

Currently, this array accepts strings and possible values that can be included are `”shippingData”` and/or `”paymentData”`.

put.description:
This request changes the price of a specific item in a cart.

You need to inform which cart you are referring to, by sending its `orderFormID`; and what is the item whose price you want to change, by sending its `itemIndex`.

You also need to pass the new price value in the body.

Remember that, to use this endpoint, the feature of *manual price* must be active. To check if it's active, use the [Get orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#getorderformconfiguration) endpoint. To make it active, use the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#updateorderformconfiguration) endpoint, making the `allowManualPrice` field `true`.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items will have the price changed.

parameters.name: itemIndex
parameters.description: The index of the item in the cart. Each cart item is identified by an index, starting in 0.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

put.description:
Your account may create `apps`, which contain custom fields, through the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/configuration#updateorderformconfiguration) request. The values of these custom fields can then be updated by this request.

To do that, you need to inform the ID of the app you created with the configuration API (`appId`).

In the body of the request, for each field created in this app (`appFieldName`) you will inform a value (`appFieldValue`).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive the new custom field values.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: ID of the app created with the configuration API.

schema.description: Here you must add the pairs of Field Name and Field Value.

put.description:
Your account may create `apps`, which contain custom fields, through the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#updateorderformconfiguration) request. The value of a specific custom field can then be updated by this request.

To do that, you need to inform in the URL the ID of the app you created with the configuration API (`appId`).

In the body of the request, you will inform the new value (`appFieldValue`, passed through the body) of the specific field created in this app (identified by the `appFieldName` parameter, passed through the URL).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: The ID of the orderForm whose custom field's value you want to change.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: ID of the app created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint.

parameters.name: appFieldName
parameters.description: Name of the app's field created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

delete.description:
Your account may create `apps`, which contain custom fields, through the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#updateorderformconfiguration) request. The value of a specific custom field can be removed by this request.

To do that, you need to inform in the URL the ID of the app you created with the configuration API (`appId`).

You also need to iform the specific field created in this app (identified by the `appFieldName` parameter, also passed through the URL) whose value you want to remove.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: The ID of the orderForm from which you want to remove the custom field value.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: ID of the app created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint.

parameters.name: appFieldName
parameters.description: Name of the app's field created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint and which will be deleted.

get.description:
Retrieves the settings that are currently applied to every orderForm in the account.

These settings are defined by the request [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/configuration#updateorderformconfiguration).

Always use this request to retrieve the current configuration before performing an update. By doing so you ensure that you are modifying only the properties you want.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description:
Determines settings that will apply to every orderForm in the account.

For example, if you create an app using this request, every orderForm of this account will have the custom fields created though it.

**Important**: always retrieve the current configuration before performing an update to ensure that you are modifying only the properties you want. Otherwise, old values can be overwritten. To retrieve the current configuration, use the request [Get orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#getorderformconfiguration).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
Retrieves a marketplace’s window to change seller, that is, the period when it is possible to choose another seller to fulfill a given order after the original seller has canceled it.

The default period for this window is of 2 days, but it can be configured by the request [Update window to change seller](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/configuration#updatewindowtochangeseller).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description:
Updates a marketplace’s window to change seller, that is, the period when it is possible to choose another seller to fulfill a given order after the original seller has canceled it.

It is possible to check the current window using the request [Get window to change seller](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/configuration#getwindowtochangeseller).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

get.description:
Retrieves possible amount of installments and respective values for a given `orderFormId` with a given payment method.

This endpoint can be used to get the installment options for only one payment method at a time.

This endpoint should be called only after the selected `orderForm` already has a `paymentData`.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the `orderForm` to be consulted for installments.

parameters.name: paymentSystem
parameters.description: ID of the payment method to be consulted for installments.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
Retrieves information on pickup points close to a given location determined by geocoordinates or postal code.

The pickup points returned are not necessarily all active ones. Make sure to validate the information consumed by integrations.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: geoCoordinates
parameters.description: Geocoordinates around which to search for pickup points. If you use this type of search, do not pass postal and country codes.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal code around which to search for pickup points. If you use this type of search, make sure to pass a `countryCode` and do not pass `geoCoordinates`.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Three letter country code refering to the `postalCode` field. Pass the country code only if you are searching pickup points by postal code.

post.summary: Place order from an existing cart
post.description:
This endpoint places an order from an existing `orderForm` object, meaning an existing cart.

After the creation of an order with this request, you have five minutes to send payment information and then request payment processing.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart from which to place the order.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

referenceId.title: referenceId
referenceId.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart from which to place the order.

savePersonalData.title: savePersonalData
savePersonalData.description: `true` if the shopper's data provided during checkout should be saved for future reference.

optinNewsLetter.title: optinNewsLetter
optinNewsLetter.description: True if the shopper opted to receive the newsletter.

value.description: Total value of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

referenceValue.description: Reference value of the order for calculating interest if that is the case. Can be equal to the total value and does not separate cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

interestValue.description: Interest rate to be used in case it applies.

put.description: Places order without having any prior cart information. This means all information on items, client, payment and shipping mus be sent in the body.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used. It is passed as part of the URL.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

items.description: Array of objects containing information on each of the order's items.

quantity.description: The quantity of items of this specific SKU in the cart to be simulated.

seller.description: The ID of the seller responsible for this SKU. This ID can be found in your VTEX Admin.

price.description: Item price within the context of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

price.description: Service price. The last two digits are the cents.

content.description: Content referring to the customization requested by the customer.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: `true` if price tag value is applied through a percentage.

isGift.description: Indicates whether the order is a gift.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

document.description: Document number informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: Company name, if the customer is a legal entity.

tradeName.description: Trade name, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

stateInscription.description: State inscription, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporatePhone.description: Corporate phone number, if the customer is a legal entity.

isCorporate.description: `true` if the customer is a legal entity.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`, among others.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

logisticsInfo.description: Array of objects containing logistics information of each item.

itemIndex.description: Index of the item in the `items` array, starting from 0.

shippingEstimate.description: Estimated time until delivery for the item.

price.description: Shipping price for the item. Does not account for the whole order's shipping price.

deliveryWindow.description: In case of scheduled delivery, this object will contain information on the delivery window selected by the shopper.

startDateUtc.description: Delivery window starting day and time in UTC.

endDateUtc.description: Delivery window ending day and time in UTC.

updateStatus.description: Indicate whether this object's information is up to date according to the order's items. An order can not be placed if `"outdated"`

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

inUse.description: Indicates whether gift card is in use.

isSpecialCard.description: Indicates whether gift card is special.

requiresDocument.description: Indicates whether a document is required.

selected.description: Indicates whether this payment system has been selected.

referenceValue.description: Reference value for calculating interest rates, in case it applies.

value.description: Value including interest, in case it applies.

updateStatus.description: Indicates whether this object's information is up to date according to the order's items. An order can not be placed if `"outdated"`

openTextField.description: Optional field meant to hold additional information about the order. We recommend using this field for text, not data formats such as `JSON` even if escaped. For that purpose, see [Creating customizable fields](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/creating-customizable-fields-in-the-cart-with-checkout-api-1)

address.reference: Bairro do foca / Posto de Saúde 65

selectedaddresses.reference: Bairro do foca / Posto de Saúde 65

items.description: Array containing information about the SKUs inside the cart to be simulated.

quantity.description: The quantity of items of this specific SKU in the cart to be simulated.

seller.description: The ID of the seller responsible for this SKU. This ID can be found in your VTEX Admin.

orderItems.description: Array containing the cart items. Each object inside this array corresponds to a different item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item inside the cart.

index.description: The index of the item in the cart. Each item is identified by an index, starting in 0.

seller.description: The seller responsible for the SKU.

id.description: The ID of the SKU in VTEX platform.

price.description: The new price of the item.

value.description: The value you want to set to the specified field.

allowExecutionAfterErrors.description: Allows the purchase to continue even if a tax system problem happens.

integratedAuthentication.description: When the tax system is in VTEX auth, use this flag instead of the `authorizationHeader`.

appId.description: Custom data ID sent to the tax system.

fields.description: Array of fields available to the app.

allowMultipleDeliveries.description: On the same purchase, allows the selection of items from multiple delivery channels.

allowManualPrice.description: Allows the editing of SKU prices right in the cart.

maxNumberOfWhiteLabelSellers.description: Allows the input of a limit of white label sellers involved on the cart.

maskFirstPurchaseData.description: Allows, on a first purchase, masking client's data. It could be useful when a shared cart is used and the client doesn't want to share its data.

requiresAuthenticationForPreAuthorizedPa.description: Determines whether pre-authorized payments require authentication

allowInstallmentsMerge.description: By default (when `false`), on a multi-seller purchase is on the run, a simple intersection with installments options configured by every seller will be available. When `true`, this option allows a more complex but flexible installment option, since it considers max installments of every seller configuration, even if those don't match. Installment values ​​may not be equal in this case.

waitingTime.description: Number of days after order cancelation by a seller, during which another seller may be assigned to fulfill the order.

tags.name: Cart Update
tags.description: This functionality allows add/remove/edit items on orderform.

tags.name: Custom Data
tags.description:
This functionality allows adding custom fields in orderform API.

These fields are not reflected in the checkout UI unless custom implementations are performed. It can be useful also for orders placed directly via checkout API.

Your configuration is made via `/configuration` API, described in this collection.

Values for `appId` and `appFieldName` must match the configuration.

tags.name: Configuration
tags.description:
**Important:** always obtain the current configuration before performing an update to ensure that you are modifying only the wanted properties, or the old values can be overwritten.

|Attribute|Type|Description|
---|---|---
| paymentConfiguration > requiresAuthenticationFor PreAuthorizedPaymentOption | boolean | * Require user authentication for automatically authorized payments|
`taxConfiguration`| object | Configuration for external tax services
 `minimumQuantityAccumulatedForItems`| integer | * Minimum number of items in cart
 `decimalDigitsPrecision`  | integer | * Number of decimal digits to be considered (0, 1 or 2)
 `minimumValueAccumulated` | integer | * Minimum total value in cart (in cents)
|`apps`| object | Custom Data configuration
|`allowMultipleDeliveries`| boolean | Feature toggle for multiple deliveries
|`allowManualPrice`| boolean |Feature toggle for manual price


\* These configurations are also available via admin: {{accountName}}.myvtex.com/admin/checkout/#/configurations

Other properties can be changed only via API:
- taxConfiguration
- apps (custom data)
- allowMultipleDeliveries
- allowManualPrice

tags.name: Order placement
tags.description: These endpoints are involved in the process of finalizing a purchase and placing the order.
